snippet: Inspectors said the two men died of carbon monoxide poisoning Sunday at a mining site in southwestern Colorado that has had a troubled safety record.
abstract: Federal mine safety inspectors are attempting to determine cause of an accident that killed two miners and injured 20 others at the Revenue Virginius Mine near mountain town of Ouray in southwestern Colorado; fallen miners, who succumbed to carbon monoxide poisoning, are identified as Nick Cappanno and Rick Williams.
lead_paragraph: Inspectors said the two men died of carbon monoxide poisoning Sunday at a mining site in southwestern Colorado that has had a troubled safety record.

headline.main: Cause of Gas Leak That Killed 2 Colorado Miners Is Sought
headline.print_headline: Cause of Gas That Killed Miners Is Sought
